intro: Lepidagathis parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, characterized by its opposite, simple leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Lepidagathis parviflora is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
